abstracts.cdata!:
The Privatization and Restructuring of
            Banks and Enterprises Technical Assistance Project aims to
            facilitate private sector-led economic growth in the Federal
            Republic of Yugoslavia (FRY) and the Republic of Serbia.
            There are two project components. The first launches and
            implements restructuring and privatization of large
            problematic socially-owned enteprises (SOEs); and the second
            component implements a comprehensive banking sector
            restructuring strategy aimed at creating a more viable
            financial sector. Specifically, the project establishes a
            consistent approach and methodology for the restructuring
            and subsequent privatization of large problematic SOEs;
            supports the restructuring and subsequent privatization of
            large loss-making enterprises by funding expert
            "restructuring agents" to prepare and implement
            "restructuring programs," privatize the saleable
            business units using internationally accepted transparent
            sales techniques, and put the unsaleable business units into
            bankruptcy; increase the capacity of the Privatization
            Agency to work with the restructuring agents to carry out
            the above-mentioned restructuring programs; and support the
            restructuring or liquidation of insolvent banks under the
            control of the Bank Rehabilitation Agency (BRA) and the
            privatization of most majority state-owned banks.
